file_content.text: [This holoterminal is offline.]
This is Darth Malgus. We've received the results of the competition.
The Colicoids were impressed by the damage you inflicted. The Republic challengers did not survive. The outcome is clear.
Then the Colicoid leaders will sell weapons to the Empire.
So we'll get Colicoid tech?
The contract is already signed.
What sort of team did the Republic field?
Who was my competition?
The Republic sent Jedi, with military and mercenary support. The mercenary escaped, and the others died.
Winning was simple.
There were those in the Ministry of War who felt this challenge would demean us--that merely participating would be a sign of weakness.
But you have seen the weapons the Colicoids produce. Envision our armies supplied with such devices, and tell me we have not done well.
In war, every weapon must be seized.
We must take every advantage.
Better equipment ends wars quickly, cleanly. That's worth any price.
New tech will save lives.
Your assistance in this matter will not be forgotten.
The challenge was demeaning, and if Colicoid technology was as good as the insects claimed, I'd be dead. Tell that to the military.
We don't need their weapons.
I believe our business is done.
[This holoterminal is offline.]
This is Darth Malgus to Vaiken Spacedock. An unusual opportunity has arisen.
The Colicoids are an insectoid species from the Inner Rim, specializing in technological sales and development; you met their lesser cousins on Balmorra.
The Colicoids' latest weapons and battle droids could change the course of the war. I desire those weapons for the Empire.
What sort of wartime technologies are the Colicoids offering?
Tell me about their weapons.
Portable shielding, ion cannons, hunter drones and more. Ground wars could be won in months instead of years.
The Balmorran Colicoids were animals. You're saying these are merchants?
But Colicoids are mindless....
The Balmorran Colicoids were biological experiments, as I understand; these are their creators.
You have the Diplomatic Service for making trade agreements. Why am I here?
I'm not your negotiator.
Republic representatives are also eager to obtain Colicoid weapons, so the insects have made a proposal:
Both Republic and Empire strike teams will compete in a war game. The Colicoids will sell technology exclusively to whichever side proves superior.
What will this competition involve?
Tell me about the war games.
The Colicoids could demand any number of things. Why make us fight for their business?
Why arrange a competition?
They wish to assess our forces before committing--there's no point in making allies who'll soon be defeated.
That "proposal" is demeaning. If the Colicoids won't trade, those weapons can be taken by force.
Let's just conquer them.
The Colicoid homeworld is far beyond Imperial space, and future developments would be lost to us; cooperation costs us nothing.
The Colicoids have designated an asteroid hive as the battleground, containing traps and challenges designed to murder competitors.
You will represent the Empire and be tested by Colicoid machines, as well as their warriors--the insects place little value on individual Colicoid life.
Whatever force the Colicoids bring to bear pales before the power of a Sith.
I will endure.
After what I did with their genetic material on Balmorra, those insects are practically family. I'll gladly pay a visit.
I always enjoy Colicoids.
I believe I can help. But in return, you need to ensure the Colicoids and the Republic can't identify me.
Just keep my part quiet.
I'll arrange it; I have no desire to compromise your undercover operations.
If I wanted to fight for an audience, I'd be a gladiator. Why should I bother?
I don't do tricks for cheap.
The payment is substantial. Consider it a chance to demonstrate that elaborate machines are no match for your ingenuity.
You want me to kill Colicoid soldiers so their leaders can decide whether you're a worthy client? It's despicable.
This whole thing is monstrous.
Wars are not won without bloodshed; do not hesitate because you fight insects instead of Jedi.
What a coincidence--I don't value Colicoid life either.
Time for a bug hunt.
The Colicoids have been observing our forces for some time; do not assume standard tactics will win this competition.
And do not fail. If the Republic wins because of our weakness, they will gain a technological advantage that could cost us a hundred worlds.
[This holoterminal is offline.]
